p: The total flavonoid content was determined using the aluminum chloride (AlCl 3) colorimetric assay adapted from Zhishen et al. [ 62]. For this measurement, 100 μL of sample was mixed in a 96-well microplate with 6 μL of 5% aqueous sodium nitrite (NaNO 2) solution. After 5 min, 6 μL of 10% aqueous AlCl 3 were added and the mixture was vortexed. Then, after 1 min incubation, 40 μL of 1 M NaOH was added. The absorbance was read at 510 nm (FLUOstar Optima, BMG Labtech). A calibration curve between 6.25 and 300 µM was prepared using a standard solution of quercetin. The total flavonoid contents were expressed as the mg quercetin equivalent (QE) per 100 g of dried plant powder.
